runs.comm: fullish ball, wide of the stumps. QdK leans into a lovely drive, but it's straight to cover, Hint of away swing for Kule.
pitches on middle and seams it away, QdK drives this down the ground, but without much power. Thisara dives at mid off to keep it to one
Amla moves across the  stumps as Kule's length ball jags back in at him. Works it off his pads wide of midwicket
goes short of a length, moves it off the surface, and beats QdK's prod outside the off stump. Lovely ball
back of a length again, but wider. QdK guides it off the face to third man
batsman moves across the stumps again, and whips a length ball off his pads to the legside sweeper
length ball on the pads, turned gently behind square by Amla

lenght outside off stump and cut powerfully, close to the body by de Kock. Not so bad a ball from Mathews, but he threw his hands at that one and got it behind backward point, all the way along the ground.
tighter, length ball from Mathews. de Kock opens the face and gets it to third man
length outside off stump, just moves slightly away from Amla off the seam, and Amla's prod is beaten. Close to the outside edge there
shortish on the body, Amla works it square on the leg side
length ball, straightening on middle. De Kock defends back to the bowler.
Amla moves across again, but Kule has caught on. Sends this wide of off stump. Amla manages to punch it to mid on and gets a single
length ball again, moving across the batsman. QdK chops down on it and gets it to point
heaved majestically over wide long on for four. Kulasekara gets too straight, doesn't move this off the pitch or in the air. It's only slightly overpitched but QdK gets under it
ohohoh! That's almost a sweep. Kule is straight again, sends down a length ball. QdK gets low, and slams that over deep square leg for a towering 79metre six
if Kusal can do it, so can I, says QdK. Thats full and outside off stump, the batsman steps out and drills that past cover and there's enough power on it to take it to the fence
Kule pulls the length back a bit and QdK punches this straight to mid off
fires this down leg, not much turn
full on leg stump, worked to wide long on
short, wide and a pretty poor misfield from sub Seekkuge Prasanna allows a four. He's fielding at cover point, and QdK's cut shot goes right through him like butter
fullish on off stump, hit back to the bowler
little bit more flight, dips nicely and QdK defends
this one is floated up outside off, and driven to cover point where it is cleanly stopped, this time
length outside off stump, Amla punches on the up to mid on
fullish on off stump, de Kock checks a drive and it goes as far as cover

bowled! Malinga special. It's a swinging yorker, of course, moving in the air away from de Kock, The batsman aims a shot towards mid on, but doesn't get anywhere near this. It hits the base of middle and off and lights up the LED bails, which are definitely in place here.
length ball on the pads, possibly a slower one. Duminy tries to flick him to leg, but misses
another lovely, swinging yoker, but Duminy is good enough to get his bat down on it
another swinging yorker, wider this time. Duminy strokes it to cover. Lovely over that's arrested South Africa's momentum.
length on off stump, Amla moves across and whips it to deep midwicket. That's been a productive shot for him
length ball angled across Duminy. He goes for a cut, but the ball wobbles away from the shot
down the leg side
length on the pads, straightening. Worked off the pads towards deep square leg
lovely flick there. Amla goes across the stumps again, gets a length ball that's now on his pads and he just casually flicks it over short fine leg for four.
length ball on the off stump, bunted to mid on for a single
length outside off stump, punched to cover
length ball outside off stump, driven to mid off
short of a length outside the off stump, and Thisara gets some surprising lift off that one. Amla tries to carve that away off the offside, but doesn't account for the bounce
short of a length outisde off, opens the face and gets it to third man
back of a length, angled across, guided to third man

big appeal from Sangakkara, but not much interest from many others, including the umpire. Short o f a length, wide of the stumps. Amla tries to cut, but again it beats his top edge. Don't think there was anything there
Perera's found his length beautifully. Back of a length again, good lift and carry. This one is closer into the batsman, who tries to dab it to third man, but he can't connect
length ball turning away outside off stump, knocked away to deep cover
nicely flighted, straightening on midle. Amla just defends
full and on off stump, punched to long off
floated on off stump, Duminy turns it to deep midwicket
Amla is down the track, but Sachithra has fired it flat and the batsman can't get under it. Hits it somewhat aerially to long on
wide length ball again, Duminy gets the forward press out and strokes it past a diving cover, the the sweeper
fullish ball outside off stump, and Duminy lets fly with a superb on drive, on the up. It's timed so well, it speeds past the bowler and to the long on fence
tighter into the stumps, Duminy opens the face and gets it behind square on the off side
length ball outside off stump, cut away to deep point
well kept. Sanga saves four there. It's full and down the leg side, Duminy tries to glance it but only gets pad to it. Sanga dives to his right and makes the stop
another good shot. Thisara overpitches outside off stump again, and this time Duminy goes over long on, hitting it hard enough for a one-bounce four

a bit of luck, but he deserved that for the innovation. It's length on the stumps, Duminy gets low and plays a scoop, it takes the toe-end of the bat, which is thick enough to send the ball all the way to the fence, right behind the keeper
length ball outside off stump, Amla cuts and misses
fullish on the stumps, hit away into a gap
Duminy doesn't want to stop the plunder. He's stepped out and bludgeoned straight back over the bowler in the air. Dilshan running accross from long off can't cut it off
OH! Another big one. This time Duminy hits it clean. A full ball from Mendis, the batsmen pick sit up and deposits it past the long on fence
flatter and faster, defended
full again. Duminy tries to sweep but misses
flat through the air, Duminy doesn't try to do much with it
fullish on the stumps, Duminy gets it into an offisde gap
now Amla gets into it. Steps out to Senanayake and carves him straight on the off side. He's hit that well enough to beat the long off running across. South Africa cantering here.
now Senanayake goes legside and Amla sweeps, well enough to beat short fine leg, but the man on the fence cuts it off

got too close that ball and Sachithra has the breakthrough. Amla tried to repeat the shot over long off, but he can't get under the ball enough and also hits it too square. In the end it goes straight to Dilshan at a shortish cover.
fullish ball, punched to long on
full, wide ball, de Villiers carves that square on the off side and picks up a couple to the sweeper
flatter, length ball. AB slaps this to cover
full and on the stumps, AB works this into a gap towards deep midwicket
jumps down the pitch and drives Mendis past the stumps for another couple

Mendis was supposed to be South Africa's nemesis, but it's not working out that way. This is a fullush Mendis ball, and AB steps back, makes room and strokes this over cover for a one-bounce four. So nearly a six
fullish on the stumps, driven down the ground
starts off with a rank thigh-high full toss and AB has no problems putting that away behind square on the leg side. That went very quickly to the fence
full ball on the stumps, driven towards mid off, where there is a single to be had
yorker, wide of the stumps. Duminy opens the face and gets it to third man
bouncer ball wide of the stumps, but it's called a wide for height, I think. Sanga leaps to collect that
full ball wide of the stumps, slapped straight to mid off
wide yorker, AB steps across and throws his bat at it, connects well enough to send it to deep cover
slower ball, length on the pads. Duminy just turns it into a massive gap square on the leg side.
length ball on off stump, Duminy charges him and strokes him to the sweeper on the off side
length ball on off stump, and there' that lovely de Villiers glide to thrid man, Gets it fine enough to collect two
fullish on the stumps, and it's driven straight to mid off
slower ball, full and outside off stump. De Villiers charged and made room, but the ball was too far for him to reach
what a shot. That was pretty much a yorker, but de Villiers has managed to drill that past a diving mid off for four. So much bottom-hand power

and he's gone! Mathews somehow contrives a breakthrough to keep Sri Lanka's hopes alive, here. De Villiers was down the track again, but Mathews pitches it short of a length a little slower, and AB only gets a top edge to the ball, which he tried to slap through the covers. Sanga makes no mistake.
full ball, straightening on the stumps. Clipped to midwicket for a single
full and outside off stump, Miller reaches out for it and drives it to deep cover
length ball, fired wide. Duminy comes down the track and strokes it to long off
length ball straightening on the stumps, Miller jumps down the track but bails out and defends
length ball turning into the leftie again, punched to long off
googly pitching on middle, turning away. Duminy picks it and drives to long on. Thoughts of two, but they settle for one
flat on middle stump, swept well in front of square to the legside sweeper
full ball, straiightening on middle, floated up. Miller squirts it out to the off side and gets a single
Duminy is down the track, but Senanayake pulls the length back. Batsman still manages to knock it gently into a massive gap around the midwicket region and they saunter two

gone! Another important breakthrough. Sri Lanka will be feeling a lot better after that one. Duminy slog-sweeps a flatter Senanayake ball outside off stump, but though he hits it well, he can't get enough elevation on it. Dilshan is at cow corner, right on the line. He doesn't make mistakes with those.
fullish on the leg stump, swept powerfully, but to the fielder
flatter again, fired in outside off stump. Morkel just punches that to cover
Miller runs at Mendis, gets a full toss on the knees and he clubs it to long on
full toss, Albie doesn't screw those up. Gets on one knee, swings his arms through and hits it high over long on for six
that's hit even better. Albie could be sealing this for South Africa. That one is overpitched, and Albie slogs it way over long on again. Shot

he's got him! I don't believe it, because that ball was there to be hit as well. Chandimal moves himself to wide long on, just square of where the two previous sixes had flown, but this time, though Albie plays a similar shot to another low full toss, he doesn't collect all of the ball. Chandi completes a pretty good catch over his head and is delighted
yorker length ball on leg-stump, Miller squeezes this away towards long on

flat, length ball turning away from the batsmen. He punches that away towards long on and sprints a single. A throw comes in and hits the stumps at the non strikers' end, but the batsman is found to be well inside the crease on replays, and what's worse for Sri Lanka, they get an extra run off the deflection
yorker on the stumps, dug out down the ground for a single

lovely shot from Miller as Malinga misses his length. This one is overpitched outside the off stump and Miller throws his hands at it and gets it past cover. The long off running around can't get close to it
a yorker on the pads, whipped away powerfully to the legside sweeper
lovely inswinging yorker from Malinga, jammed out nicely by Behaardien. Gets it far enough away from Malinga to get a single
another yorker, again dug out nicely towards long off. Thisara Perera is slow to come off the fence and it allows two, much to Sanga's dismay
yorker on the stumps, but Miller is not even slightly troubled by it. Hits it to midwicket for a single and keeps the strike. Ten off that over
yorker on off stump first up, drilled to long off where it's nicely fielded

gone! Behardien goes, it gets Miller on strike, but Sri Lanka will take that, if nothing else, because it's a dot ball. Kule slowed up his pace a touch, and delivered a length ball on off stump. Behaardien slogged at it, but didn't connect well at all. Hits it down Mahela's throat at long on.
superb running. Steyn with a sore hamstring does very well. That was another yorker, squeezed out wide of long on by Miller, but he calls his partner through and they get there safely
another yorker, driven wide of long off, but Steyn refuses the second this time
Wide yorker, slower ball as well, nicely bowled by Kule. Steyn throws his bat at it but doesn't connect
lovely over from Kule. Yorker again, this time about a foot wide of off. Steyn tries to drive that down the ground but misses again. Kule celebrates with a fist pump.

Steyn is running down the pitch, but Miller sends him back and oh dear, what a silly way to go. The batsmen should have been talking about whether Miller needed to keep strike during this over or not, but they clearly had not. Miller squeezes an impeccable yorker out to midwicket, and although there is a tight run there, he doesn't want to hand Steyn the strike. By the time Steyn turns back, Malinga is directing the ball onto the stumps, albeit with a fumble.

gone, that's probably all over. Sri Lanka keeping their nerve, because they play a last-ball finish every other week, while South Africa are just giving it away. Another yorker, this time drilled to long off, and Miller jogs down the pitch for the first one, as if he doesn't want the second. Suddenly when he reaches the non-striker's he decides he wants two. It's far too late by then. The throw is already on its way to Sanga, who breaks the stumps with Miller miles out. Sri Lanka feel they've won it now
yorker again, dug out to mid off, batsmen think about running but they don't
Tahir gets under this one which is just short of being a yorker, It goes high over mid off, who goes haring after it, but doesn't get there
squeezed out straight to cover, Sri Lanka know they have this now, as long as Malinga doesn't overstep

six, that's some shot, actually, but one that doesn't make much of a difference. That was the first poor ball Malinga delivered in the over, overpitched on middle stump. Tahir backs away, clears the front him and larrups that over deep extra cover for a big six.
